title: Mitigating Knowledge Conflicts in Knowledge-Augmented Generation via Parametric Pruning
author: Pengcheng Huang (Northeastern University), Zhenghao Liu (Northeastern University), Yukun Yan (Tsinghua University), Xiaoyuan Yi (Microsoft Research Asia), Hao Chen (Tsinghua University), Zhiyuan Liu (Tsinghua University), Maosong Sun (Tsinghua University), Tong Xiao (Northeastern University), Ge Yu (Northeastern University), Chenyan Xiong (Carnegie Mellon University)
relevance_why: This paper's focus on reducing knowledge conflicts through pruning internal knowledge could directly enhance research on audio generation models by implementing similar methods to manage conflicting information in audio data sources.
background: The task involves addressing knowledge conflicts in Large Language Models during Knowledge-Augmented Generation, where internal memory may contradict external sourced information.
contribution: This paper introduces the ParametrIc Pruning-based Knowledge-Augmented Generation (PIP-KAG) to solve knowledge conflicts in LLMs, achieving better context fidelity and reducing overall model parameters by 13%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on enhancing external knowledge usage but failed to effectively address the influence of internal knowledge.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by implementing parameter pruning to effectively uninstall conflicting internal knowledge, thereby enabling better reliance on external knowledge.

key_innovation: The use of neuron activation-based pruning allows for more effective handling of knowledge conflicts, enhancing the reliability of generated responses.
real_world_impact: This approach can improve the accuracy and relevance of information retrieval and generation tasks in various applications, such as conversational agents and knowledge-based systems.
limitations: The pruning process may inadvertently affect non-knowledge-related neurons, potentially impacting model performance.

new_terms.Knowledge-Augmented Generation: **Knowledge-Augmented Generation** refers to integrating external knowledge sources into language models to enhance their performance in generating accurate responses.
new_terms.neuron inhibition: **Neuron inhibition** describes the reduction in activity (or activation) of certain neurons in a neural network that occurs when new information is processed.
